title: Asta Kosala Kosali
text: The principle or guideline of Balinese architecture, which depicts parts and their locations in a house. In a Balinese house compound, there are segregated parts to separate the elements of sanctity and impiety (being dirty); Head (temple or family shrine, sleeping pavilion), Body (pavilion for receiving guests, for working), Legs (pavilion for taking shower, pigsty). Temples or shrines are situated higher than any other parts of a house.
